term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - preconcentration coefficient of a desired microcomponent, in trace analysis
term.title: preconcentration coefficient

item.text: This is defined as K = (QT/QM)/(QTo/QMo) and Q T o are the quantities of the microcomponent in the concentrate and in the sample, respectively (mass units or concentration units), and Q M o and Q M and are the quantities of the matrix before and after preconcentration, respectively. If the recovery is 100%, K = QMo/QM. The terms enrichment coefficient and enrichment factor are not recommended.

sources.item: PAC, 1979, 51, 1195. 'Separation and Preconcentration of Trace Substances. I-Preconcentration for Inorganic Trace Analysis' on page 1198 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac197951051195)
